pullRequest.body:
* `MonoidAlgebra.rTensorAlgEquiv`: the tensor product of `MonoidAlgebra M α` with `N` is `R`-linearly equivalent  to `MonoidAlgebra (M ⊗[R] N) α`

* `MonoidAlgebra.scalarRTensorAlgEquiv`, the tensor product of `MonoidAlgebra R α` with `N` is `R`-linearly equivalent to `MonoidAlgebra N α`

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Contrary to the case of polynomials and multivariate polynomials, this does not look so useful and I prefer to close it now.
I'd be tempted to keep this because it provides the multivariate polynomial version for free.
The point is that all functions are trivial in this case. What makes the case of multivariate polynomials interesting is the relation with coefficients, MvPolynomial.sum, etc.

OK, `coeff` and `monomial` don't exist, but one can “apply”, and use `MonoidAlgebra.single` to add functions equivalent to what is done for `MvPolynomial` in #12293 .
The initial lemmas have been commented out and one of them is done explicitly, I should restore something because this half-functoriality of MonoidAlgebra is important and playing with `liftNC` all the time is painful.

Untested:
```suggestion
variable (R) in
/-- `MvPolynomial.coeff m` but promoted to a `LinearMap`. -/
@[simps apply]
def lcoeff (m : σ →₀ ℕ) : MvPolynomial σ R →ₗ[R] R where
  toFun := coeff m
  map_add' := coeff_add m
  map_smul' := coeff_smul m
```

Yes, that works, as pointed out by @erdOne in the comments to #12293.  
This file is common to the 3 PR, I did not take the time to sort out which of these modifications were necessary. I'm sorry for the useless work.
If these PRs share commen code and you don't want to spend time to extract the dependency, can you mark them as dependencies in some arbitrary order to avoid further duplicate work?

I'll do that, sorry. 
Let's make the dependency in the order they are.

So Lean creates the _apply lemma, but it has R as an explicit argument. 
This is not such a nuisance, I believe. Maybe we should be satisfied with this. 
(Maybe `simps` has to be refined so as to put implicit arguments when desired.)
I think this is best kept as the separate lemmas we already have; repeating every lemma about a function `foo` for `fooOneHom`, `fooZeroHom` etc doesn't scale.

I mean that the caller should be expected to write `rw [addMonoidHom_apply, mapRange_single]` rather than using this lemma; or `dsimp; rw [mapRange_single]`. The first step in most proofs should be to let `dsimp` clean up any bundled functions to bring things into a standard form that we have lemmas for.
I deleted the lemma.
I think this might already exists; something like `MonoidAlgebra.liftNC` or similar?

docs#MonoidAlgebra.liftNCRingHom does take into account the multiplicative structure, but uses `Monoid`, while here `MulOneClass` is enough. What should one do? (I am not sure that docs#MonoidAlgebra.liftNCRingHom can be generalized, docs#MonoidAlgebra.liftNC_mul does not suffice, apparently.)

At least, one can give the shorter (but less general) definition 
```
/-- RingHom functoriality for the monoid algebra -/
noncomputable def ringHom [Monoid α] (e : N →+* P) :
    MonoidAlgebra N α →+* MonoidAlgebra P α := by
  apply liftNCRingHom (singleOneRingHom.comp e) (of P α)
  intro n a
  simp only [commute_iff_eq, RingHom.coe_comp, Function.comp_apply,
    singleOneRingHom_apply, ZeroHom.toFun_eq_coe, AddMonoidHom.toZeroHom_coe,
    singleAddHom_apply, of_apply, single_mul_single, one_mul, mul_one]
```
and I can try proving the lemmas for them. (This is not as obvious, I need to understand why!)

That works, but one loses the fact that it corresponds with docs#Finsupp.mapRange…
In the current version, proofs/definitions exist in two ways, to help you decide which way is better.
If one uses docs#Finsupp.mapRange, the hypotheses on alpha can be relaxed to MulOneClass, but the way through docs#MonoidAlgebra.liftNC uses Monoid.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (ringHom (RingHom.id N) : MonoidAlgebra N α →+* MonoidAlgebra N α) ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ((ringHom e).comp (ringHom f) : MonoidAlgebra M α →+* MonoidAlgebra P α) ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion simp? ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ((ringHom e).comp (ringHom f) : MonoidAlgebra M α →+* MonoidAlgebra P α) ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion simp? ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion simp? ```

feat(Mathlib.RingTheory.TensorProduct.Polynomial) : tensor product of a (univariate) polynomial ring
[Merged by Bors] - feat(Mathlib.RingTheory.TensorProduct.MvPolynomial) :  tensor product of a (multivariate) polynomial ring
